intro: Pseudognaphalium alatocaule, commonly known as the silverleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, silver-haired leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. The species is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in harsh, arid conditions.
